meanings.definition: To make white or pale by extracting color; bleach.
meanings.sent1: She used a special powder to blanch the fabric and make it lighter.
meanings.sent2: The chef will blanch the almonds before adding them to the salad.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to blanch the red scarf into a white one!
meanings.sent4: The moonlight seemed to blanch the whole garden, turning it into a mystical place.
meanings.sent5: The snow-covered landscape blanched under the bright sun, creating a serene scene.

meanings.definition: To scald in boiling water and remove the skin or outer covering of.
meanings.sent1: Please blanch the tomatoes before peeling them for the sauce.
meanings.sent2: The recipe calls for blanching the hazelnuts to easily remove their shells.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef accidentally blanched his finger while trying to peel the potatoes!
meanings.sent4: The hot water seemed to blanch the vegetables quickly, making them ready for cooking.
meanings.sent5: The steam from the pot rose up to blanch the shrimp, preparing them for the dish.

meanings.sent1: The flowers will blanch in the absence of sunlight.
meanings.sent2: His face started to blanch as he heard the unexpected news.
meanings.sent3: The ghostly figure seemed to blanch even more under the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The fear in her eyes caused her to blanch, losing all color in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The sudden cold wind made the leaves blanch, signaling the arrival of winter.
